docs.lead_paragraph: The oath of office was not administered to the Vice-President on the 4th inst. Mr. RODNEY, our Vice-Consul, visited Mr. KING on the 3d for the purpose; but Mr. K. considered the ceremony unnecessary, fearing that he should never be able to reach Washington to assume the duties of the office, and if he should, the oath could be administered at Washington.

headline.main: FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; ARRIVAL OF THE GLASGOW AND AFRICA. Relations of France and Turkey. AUSTRIA AND THE MONTENEGRINS. MORE RUMORS FROM MILAN. Cotton and Flour dull--General Trade active.

docs.lead_paragraph: The propeller Glasgow, Capt. CRAIG, from Glasgow on the 24th ult., arrived at this port on Saturday afternoon; and the Cunard steamship Africa reached port yesterday, after a passage of fifteen days from Liverpool, whence she brings dates to the 27th ult.

docs.lead_paragraph: New-Orleans papers of Saturday last, are to hand, but contain no news of interest. Mrs. PIERCE is still in Baltimore, tolerably well in health, but her spirits are still much depressed. The President returned to Washington yesterday afternoon.
docs.snippet: New-Orleans papers of Saturday last, are to hand, but contain no news of interest. Mrs. PIERCE is still in Baltimore, tolerably well in health, but her spirits are still much depressed. The President returned to Washington yesterday afternoon.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following items from the Appendix to Controller FLAGG'S excellent Report just published, will enable our citizens to understand how the City Government manage to get rid of so large an amount of the public money.
docs.snippet: The following items from the Appendix to Controller FLAGG'S excellent Report just published, will enable our citizens to understand how the City Government manage to get rid of so large an amount of the public money.

docs.lead_paragraph: The first decision under the new Steamboat law, has been made at Cincinnati, in the case of the collision between the steamers Falls City and the Pittsburg. The regulations requiring the "ringing of the bells and blowing the whistles at intervals of two minutes, when running in a fog," were not complied with. The pilots of both boats have been suspended for ten days.

headline.main: MORAL AND RELIGIOUS.; Church and Missionary Intelligence.

docs.lead_paragraph: The American Bible Society has commenced issuing the new edition of the Scriptures, as revised by the Committee on Versions. Many misprints have occurred in the former issues, and the revision of these errors was some time since confided to a Committee, whose labors here begin to show fruits.

docs.lead_paragraph: DEATH OF A PHILANTHROPIST.--The sudden death of JOHN B. GRAHAM, announced yesterday, cast a general gloom over the city. Of late he had been enjoying his usual health, with the exception of one day (Wednesday) of this week. He was advised to remain within his house, and not expose himself to the inclement weather.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the Buffalo Commercial Advertiser. The following letter, addressed by Mr. FILL MORE to Mr. BARTON, late Mayor of the City, has been handed us for publication: WASHINGTON, Friday, March 4, 1853.

headline.main: Arrival of a Captured Slaver at Norfolk.

docs.lead_paragraph: PETITIONS PRESENTED AND REFERRED. Mr. COOLEY presented a petition of three citizens of New-York against the law relating to ecclesiastical devises. Mr. McMURRAY, of the Common Council of New-York for an increase in the number of Commissioners of Deeds.
